intro: Galphimia multicaulis, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red or orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Galphimia multicaulis typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
